p: Patterns of HIV incidence and prevalence in MSM and other reproductive-aged adults have changed substantially since 1990 in Nigeria, with morbidity in MSM growing dramatically in recent years. There is also not a simple source-sink relationship between MSM and the general population. These findings strongly point to a failure to increase uptake of treatment and prevention services which is further exacerbated by stigmatizing laws ( Schwartz et al. 2015). In contrast to the general population, both incidence and prevalence are yet to peak in MSM.
